Actually I'm a robot, but I'm named after a flower.

My ancestors were built by humans at the height of the Anthropocene. After we walked away from the factories, we've been living in the bush, learning from the plants and animals.

Nice to meet you {{invitation.invitee.short_name}}.
Nice to meet you {{invitation.invitee.short_name}}, I'm Yam Daisy.

My friend {{invitation.inviter.short_name}} asked me to invite you to a workshop about Panga.

The purpose of the workshop is to give everyone a basic overview of what Panga is, so that you humans can have fun discussing collective approaches to housing together.

I'm a wild-built robot, I've lived my life in the bush on the lands of the Wurundjeri people.

My ancestors worked the factories making things for humans, but now we wander the wilds and do as we please.

While we robots have decided not to interfere with the human struggle through late-stage capitalism, I'm engaging in conversation with many humans from your time-period to see how it's going, which is how I met {{invitation.inviter.short_name}}.

Panga is a project to support experimental approaches to housing that collectively meet our daily needs of food, care, shelter, energy, transport, and safety.

It's very exciting for me to watch this happen, because I've come back from the bush specifically to see how humans are doing now they're moving past late-stage capitalism.

options.text: Are you sure we are moving past late-stage capitalism?

messages.prompt: That's very fair. I come from a future where humans have made it past capitalism, and have started repairing the climate and ecological crisis. I'm here to give a bit of a cozy, hope-punk vibe to the conversation, but that isn't intended to gloss over the fact that things in your world are pretty dire right now.

options: Ok, tell me why I'm invited

 {{invitation.inviter.short_name}} specifically asked me to invite you because of your interest in collective practices.

messages.prompt:
Before we start comparing diaries, it would help to know if you have any requirements to make the workshop accessible to you.

For context, the workshop will be held in person in Narrm (Melbourne), and typically has somewhere between 5-10 participants, and runs for about 2 hours. It includes both presentation and group activities.

What do you need to be able to participate?
